qas.question: Since when have Portuguese universities existed?
Where was the oldest Portuguese university established?
Where did the oldest Portuguese university relocate to?
What is the oldest engineering school of the Americas?

answers.text: the Real Academia de Artilharia, Fortificação e Desenho of Rio de Janeiro

qas.question: What is the oldest medical college in Asia?

context: Portuguese universities have existed since <a0_0>1290<a0_0/>. The oldest Portuguese university was first established in <a1_0>Lisbon<a1_0/> before moving to <a2_0>Coimbra<a2_0/>. Historically, within the scope of the Portuguese Empire, the Portuguese founded the oldest engineering school of the Americas (<a3_0>the Real Academia de Artilharia, Fortificação e Desenho of Rio de Janeiro<a3_0/>) in 1792, as well as the oldest medical college in Asia (<a4_0>the Escola Médico-Cirúrgica of Goa<a4_0/>) in 1842. The largest university in Portugal is the University of Lisbon.
